title: Group multiple operation
content: The "group multiple" operation (if the group is multiplicative, also called "group power" or "group exponentiation" operation), can be defined for arbitrary magmas, if the multiplier/exponent is a nonnegative integer. See also the definition in [Lang] p. 6, where an element ` x `(of a monoid) to the power of a nonnegative integer ` n ` is defined and denoted by ` x ^ n `. Definition ~ df-mulg , however, defines the group multiple for arbitrary (i.e. also negative) integers. This is meaningful for groups only, and requires the definition ~ df-minusg of the inverse operation ` invg ` .

blocks.name: cmg
blocks.content: Extend class notation with a function mapping a group operation to the multiple/power operation for the magma/group.
blocks.origin: const class cmg { .g }

df-mulg
blocks.content: Define the group multiple function, also known as group exponentiation when viewed multiplicatively. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-mulg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cmg, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cz, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cif(cfv(c0g, cv(s0)), csb(s3, cseq(nat1, cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), cxp(cn, csn(cv(s2)))), cif(cfv(cv(s3), cv(s1)), cfv(cfv(cminusg, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s3), cneg(cv(s1)))), wbr(nat0, clt, cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s1), nat0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-mulg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ .g =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà ‚Ñ§, s2 ‚àà(Base ` s0)‚Ü¶ if(s1 = 0,(0 ` s0),[seq(1((+ ` s0),(‚Ñï √ó { s2 })))/ s3]if(0[<]s1,(s3 ` s1),((invg ` s0)`(s3 ` -u(s1)))))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
}

  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(1[c2]c0)= c0)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Base ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(.g ` c3)
} = {
  eqtrd((1[c2]c0), c0, (seq(1((+ ` c3),(‚Ñï √ó { c0 })))` 1), c0 ‚àà c1)
  mpan(c0 ‚àà c1, (1[c2]c0)=(seq(1((+ ` c3),(‚Ñï √ó { c0 })))` 1), 1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  mulgnn(nat1, c0, c1, c2, seq(1((+ ` c3),(‚Ñï √ó { c0 }))), c3, (+ ` c3))
  eqid((+ ` c3))
  eqid(seq(1((+ ` c3),(‚Ñï √ó { c0 }))))
  seq1i(nat1, (+ ` c3), (‚Ñï √ó { c0 }), c0, c0 ‚àà c1)
  1z()
  mpan2(c0 ‚àà c1, ((‚Ñï √ó { c0 })` 1)= c0, 1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  1nn()
  fvconst2g(c0, c1, nat1, cn)
}

thm mulgnnp1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, nat1), c3, c1), co(co(c0, c3, c1), c4, c1)))

  3eqtr4d(co(co(c0, caddc, nat1), c3, c1), co(co(c0, c3, c1), c4, c1), cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), co(c0, caddc, nat1)), co(cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), c0), c4, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2)))
  eqtrd(cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), co(c0, caddc, nat1)), co(cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), c0), c4, c1), co(cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), c0), c4, cfv(cxp(cn, csn(c1)), co(c0, caddc, nat1))), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), co(c0, caddc, nat1)), co(cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), c0), c4, cfv(cxp(cn, csn(c1)), co(c0, caddc, nat1)))), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat1)))
  syl6eleq(c0, cfv(cuz, nat1), cn, wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2))
  nnuz()
  seqp1(c0, nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1)))
  oveq2d(cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), c0), c4, cfv(cxp(cn, csn(c1)), co(c0, caddc, nat1)), c1, wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2)))
  syl2anr(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(cxp(cn, csn(c1)), co(c0, caddc, nat1)), c1), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cn))
  id(wcel(c1, c2))
  fvconst2g(c1, c2, co(c0, caddc, nat1), cn)
  sylan(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, nat1), c3, c1), cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), co(c0, caddc, nat1))), wcel(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cn))
  peano2nn(c0)
  mulgnn(co(c0, caddc, nat1), c1, c2, c3, cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), c5, c4)
  oveq1d(co(c0, c3, c1), c4, c1, cfv(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), c0), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2)))
  mulgnn(c0, c1, c2, c3, cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))), c5, c4)
  eqid(cseq(nat1, c4, cxp(cn, csn(c1))))
}

blocks.name: mulg2
blocks.content: Group multiple (exponentiation) operation at two. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mulg2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(co(nat2, c2, c0), co(c0, c3, c0)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cmg, c4))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cplusg, c4))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(nat2, c2, c0), co(c0, c3, c0), co(co(nat1, c2, c0), c3, c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  syl5eq(co(nat2, c2, c0), co(co(nat1, c2, c0), c3, c0), co(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), c2, c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  oveq1i(nat2, c2, c0, co(nat1, caddc, nat1))
  df-2()
  mpan(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(co(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), c2, c0), co(co(nat1, c2, c0), c3, c0)), wcel(nat1, cn))
  1nn()
  mulgnnp1(nat1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4)
  oveq1d(co(nat1, c2, c0), c3, c0, c0, wcel(c0, c1))
  mulg1(c0, c1, c2, c4)
}

thm mulg2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(2[c2]c0)=(c0[c3]c0))
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Base ` c4)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(.g ` c4)

} = {
  eqtrd((2[c2]c0), (c0[c3]c0), ((1[c2]c0)[c3]c0), c0 ‚àà c1)

  oveq1i(nat2, c2, c0, (1[+]1))
  df-2()
  mpan(c0 ‚àà c1, ((1[+]1)[c2]c0)=((1[c2]c0)[c3]c0), 1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)

  mulgnnp1(nat1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4)
  oveq1d((1[c2]c0), c3, c0, c0, c0 ‚àà c1)

}

  eqtrd(cif(cfv(c0g, c5), cif(cfv(cseq(nat1, cfv(cplusg, c5), cxp(cn, csn(c1))), cneg(c0)), cfv(c4, cfv(cseq(nat1, cfv(cplusg, c5), cxp(cn, csn(c1))), cneg(cneg(c0)))), wbr(nat0, clt, cneg(c0))), wceq(cneg(c0), nat0)), cfv(c4, cfv(cseq(nat1, cfv(cplusg, c5), cxp(cn, csn(c1))), cneg(cneg(c0)))), cif(cfv(cseq(nat1, cfv(cplusg, c5), cxp(cn, csn(c1))), cneg(c0)), cfv(c4, cfv(cseq(nat1, cfv(cplusg, c5), cxp(cn, csn(c1))), cneg(cneg(c0)))), wbr(nat0, clt, cneg(c0))), wcel(c0, cn))

blocks.name: mulgnn0p1
blocks.content: Group multiple (exponentiation) operation at a successor, extended to ` NN0 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Dec-2014.)

thm mulgnn0p1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), c4, c2), co(co(c1, c4, c2), c5, c2)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cmg, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cplusg, c0))
} = {
  mpjaodan(w3a(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), c4, c2), co(co(c1, c4, c2), c5, c2)), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(c1, nat0))
  syl2anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), c4, c2), co(co(c1, c4, c2), c5, c2)), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c2, c3))
  simpr(w3a(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c1, cn))
  simpl3(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c1, cn))
  mulgnnp1(c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c0)
  imp(w3a(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(c1, nat0), wceq(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), c4, c2), co(co(c1, c4, c2), c5, c2)))
  syl5ibrcom(w3a(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(c1, nat0), wceq(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), c4, c2), co(co(c1, c4, c2), c5, c2)), wceq(co(nat1, c4, c2), co(co(nat0, c4, c2), c5, c2)))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(co(nat1, c4, c2), co(co(nat0, c4, c2), c5, c2)))
  3eqtr4rd(co(nat1, c4, c2), co(co(nat0, c4, c2), c5, c2), co(cfv(c0g, c0), c5, c2), c2, wa(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c2, c3)))
  mndlid(c0, c2, c3, cfv(c0g, c0), c5)
  oveq1d(co(nat0, c4, c2), c5, c2, cfv(c0g, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c2, c3)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(co(nat0, c4, c2), cfv(c0g, c0)))
  mulg0(c2, c3, c4, cfv(c0g, c0), c0)
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c0))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(co(nat1, c4, c2), c2))
  mulg1(c2, c3, c4, c0)
  eqeq12d(co(co(c1, caddc, nat1), c4, c2), co(co(c1, c4, c2), c5, c2), co(nat1, c4, c2), co(co(nat0, c4, c2), c5, c2), wceq(c1, nat0))
  oveq1d(co(c1, caddc, nat1), c4, c2, nat1, wceq(c1, nat0))
  syl6eqr(co(c1, caddc, nat1), nat1, co(nat0, caddc, nat1), wceq(c1, nat0))
  oveq1(c1, nat0, caddc, nat1)
  1e0p1()
  oveq1d(co(c1, c4, c2), c5, c2, co(nat0, c4, c2), wceq(c1, nat0))
  oveq1(c1, nat0, c4, c2)
  sylib(w3a(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3)), wo(wcel(c1, cn), wceq(c1, nat0)), wcel(c1, cn0))
  simp2(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, cn0), wcel(c2, c3))
  elnn0(c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mulgnn0p1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Mnd ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí((c1[+]1)[c4]c2)=((c1[c4]c2)[c5]c2))
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Base ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(.g ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(+ ` c0)
} = {
  mpjaodan((c0 ‚àà Mnd ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), ((c1[+]1)[c4]c2)=((c1[c4]c2)[c5]c2), c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï, c1 = 0)
  syl2anc(((c0 ‚àà Mnd ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï), ((c1[+]1)[c4]c2)=((c1[c4]c2)[c5]c2), c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï, c2 ‚àà c3)
  simpr((c0 ‚àà Mnd ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  simpl3(c0 ‚àà Mnd, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, c2 ‚àà c3, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï)
  mulgnnp1(c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c0)
  imp((c0 ‚àà Mnd ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), c1 = 0, ((c1[+]1)[c4]c2)=((c1[c4]c2)[c5]c2))
  syl5ibrcom((c0 ‚àà Mnd ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), c1 = 0, ((c1[+]1)[c4]c2)=((c1[c4]c2)[c5]c2), (1[c4]c2)=((0[c4]c2)[c5]c2))
  3adant2(c0 ‚àà Mnd, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, c2 ‚àà c3, (1[c4]c2)=((0[c4]c2)[c5]c2))
  3eqtr4rd((1[c4]c2), ((0[c4]c2)[c5]c2), ((0 ` c0)[c5]c2), c2, (c0 ‚àà Mnd ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3))
  mndlid(c0, c2, c3, (0 ` c0), c5)
  oveq1d((0[c4]c2), c5, c2, (0 ` c0), (c0 ‚àà Mnd ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3))
  adantl(c0 ‚àà Mnd, c2 ‚àà c3, (0[c4]c2)=(0 ` c0))
  mulg0(c2, c3, c4, (0 ` c0), c0)
  eqid((0 ` c0))
  adantl(c0 ‚àà Mnd, c2 ‚àà c3, (1[c4]c2)= c2)
  mulg1(c2, c3, c4, c0)
  eqeq12d(((c1[+]1)[c4]c2), ((c1[c4]c2)[c5]c2), (1[c4]c2), ((0[c4]c2)[c5]c2), c1 = 0)
  oveq1d((c1[+]1), c4, c2, nat1, c1 = 0)
  syl6eqr((c1[+]1), nat1, (0[+]1), c1 = 0)
  oveq1(c1, nat0, caddc, nat1)
  1e0p1()
  oveq1d((c1[c4]c2), c5, c2, (0[c4]c2), c1 = 0)
  oveq1(c1, nat0, c4, c2)
  sylib((c0 ‚àà Mnd ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3), (c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï ‚à® c1 = 0), c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
  simp2(c0 ‚àà Mnd, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, c2 ‚àà c3)
  elnn0(c1)
}

blocks.name: mulgnnsubcl
blocks.content: Closure of the group multiple (exponentiation) operation in a subsemigroup. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mulgnnsubcl(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w3a(w0, wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(co(c0, c3, c1), c2))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c5))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cmg, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cplusg, c5))

blocks.content: The inverse of a negative group multiple is the positive group multiple. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Apr-2009.) (Revised by AV, 30-Aug-2021.)

thm mulgnegneg(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(cfv(c4, co(cneg(c1), c5, c2)), co(c1, c5, c2)))

  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cminusg, c0))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(c4, co(cneg(c1), c5, c2)), co(c1, c5, c2), cfv(c4, cfv(c4, co(c1, c5, c2))), w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3)))
  fveq2d(c4, co(cneg(c1), c5, c2), cfv(c4, co(c1, c5, c2)), w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3)))
  mulgneg(c0, c1, c2, c3, c5, c4)
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c4, co(c1, c5, c2))), co(c1, c5, c2)), wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(co(c1, c5, c2), c3))
  simp1(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3))
  mulgcl(c0, c1, c2, c3, c5)
  grpinvinv(c0, co(c1, c5, c2), c3, c4)

  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))

blocks.content: The group multiple operator commutes with the group inverse function. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Apr-2009.) (Revised by AV, 31-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: mulginvinv
blocks.content: The group multiple operator commutes with the group inverse function. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Apr-2009.) (Revised by AV, 31-Aug-2021.)

thm mulginvinv(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(cfv(c4, co(c1, c5, cfv(c4, c2))), co(c1, c5, c2)))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cmg, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cminusg, c0))
} = {
  eqtr3d(cfv(c4, co(c1, c5, cfv(c4, c2))), co(c1, c5, c2), co(c1, c5, cfv(c4, cfv(c4, c2))), w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3)))
  syld3an3(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(co(c1, c5, cfv(c4, cfv(c4, c2))), cfv(c4, co(c1, c5, cfv(c4, c2)))), wcel(cfv(c4, c2), c3))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(cfv(c4, c2), c3))
  grpinvcl(c0, c2, c3, c4)
  mulginvcom(c0, c1, cfv(c4, c2), c3, c5, c4)
  oveq2d(c1, c5, cfv(c4, cfv(c4, c2)), c2, w3a(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3)))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c4, c2)), c2))
  grpinvinv(c0, c2, c3, c4)
}

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí(c4 `(c1[c5](c4 ` c2)))=(c1[c5]c2))

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Mnd ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)‚Üí(c1[c2]c3)= c3)

blocks.name: mulgdir
blocks.content: Sum of group multiples, generalized to ` ZZ ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cmg, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cplusg, c0))
} = {
  mpjaodan(wa(wcel(c0, cgrp), w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c3, c4))), wceq(co(co(c1, caddc, c2), c5, c3), co(co(c1, c5, c3), c6, co(c2, c5, c3))), wcel(co(c1, caddc, c2), cn0), wcel(cneg(co(c1, caddc, c2)), cn0))

blocks.content: Reversed product of group multiples. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Apr-2009.) (Revised by AV, 30-Aug-2021.)

  ‚ä£ c4 =(Base ` c0)

  eqtrd(((c2[√ó]c1)[c5]c3), (c1[c5](c2[c5]c3)), ((c1[√ó]c2)[c5]c3), (c0 ‚àà Grp ‚àß(c1 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚àß c2 ‚àà ‚Ñ§ ‚àß c3 ‚àà c4)))

blocks.name: mulgmodid
blocks.content: Casting out multiples of the identity element leaves the group multiple unchanged. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Apr-2009.) (Revised by AV, 30-Aug-2021.)

blocks.name: mulgpropd
blocks.content: Two structures with the same group-nature have the same group multiple function. ` K ` is expected to either be ` _V ` (when strong equality is available) or ` B ` (when closure is available). (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 21-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2015.)

thm mulgpropd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, c1))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cmg, c2))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cmg, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c2)))

blocks.name: submmulgcl
blocks.content: Closure of the group multiple (exponentiation) operation in a submonoid. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jan-2015.)

thm submmulgcl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cmg, c1))
} = {

  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))

  eqid(cfv(cplusg, c1))
  subm0cl(c0, c1, cfv(c0g, c1))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c1))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)

  diff.hs0.c(c1)

  diff.hs1.c(c2)

  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cfv(cbs, c1))

  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(c0, cfv(csubmnd, c1)))
}
